author: vicepool
title: ADAPlus - Pool Market
description: Delegators are looking for places to maximize their staking rewards. Pools are actively marketing to attract new delegators.

author: jochen.leinberger
title: Governance for Rewards donation
description: Dedicating pool rewards to one organization is limiting the impact of a Pool and its ability to attract a diverse audience of delegators.

author: felixweber
title: Community Pool Network
description: Achieving more decentralization requires more tools for self-governance for different communities in the ecosystem.

author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: SPO DAO
description: DAO Net seeks to maintain a floor value for DAO tokens, using babel fees, however incentives are needed for SPOs to provide this service.

author: abehazbunjr
title: Dropnir: Pool-Powered CNFT Markets
description: There are not enough levers available to stake pool operators to differentiate themselves, engage with audiences and onboard new users.

author: openlittermap
title: The Littercoin Stake Pool
description: People are earning Littercoin but the token needs value for retailers to accept it.

author: toby
title: https://www.cardanoworld.io
description: There is no one combining a cardano-explorer with the projects evolving (project-explorer). There is no single point of entry, no overview.

author: jeffyang1
title: Token Minting Service
description: Small pool needs to offer more incentives to offer delegators to grow their business because people just want the most rewards.

author: kareemb
title: SPO as anti-Climate Change vehicle
description: The climate is heating, governments + industry aren't moving fast enough. We can use the SPO structure to fund carbon sequester credits.

author: dowdcspark
title: Raspberry /SPO Project
description: The memory of RaspberryPi4 is 8GB and a spec of about 16GB is required. It contains unnecessary features and needs further optimization.

author: dcspark
title: Milkomeda SPO validator training
description: Milkomeda requires a distributed set of validators to achieve sufficient decentralization

author: adarocket
title: Monitoring solution for a node
description: Most SPOs use gLiveView to track the node status (requires access to the cmd line) or prometheus/graphana, where is lack of essencial data

author: stakepool247
title: SPO Performance Monitoring Service
description: Stake Pool Operators lack live monitoring tools that would provide information about their Stake Pool Performance to them and delegators.

author: everstake
title: Cardanomonitor
description: As the Cardano ecosystem and SPO role grow, there is a need for new infrastructure and services.

author: reginawills
title: SPO & trading in Cardano ecosystem
description: Helping fellow East Africans to find diversity of Investment opportunities in the Cardano ecosystem

author: passthenachos
title: Charity Funding SPO
description: Underprivileged children lack access to financial education programs. Giving funds to children must have a parents approval and management

author: thomas.langlois
title: Cardanobi.io
description: There's a great deal of value locked in the data processed by Cardano and its ecosystem. How to extract it and make it available to all?

author: geekship
title: SOIL: PRISM Pools
description: SPOs need to attract delegators

author: larde.victor
title: (Close to) Free energy SPO by OST
description:
PoS is energy efficient, but is not zero energy.   
Setting-up a SPO is not for everyone, not affordable for those who want decentralization.

author: heinz.gassner
title: Establish SPO 2.0 Blueprint
description: Cardano has an impressive number of SPOs, but not all are successful. There is also a strong narrative that it is too late to get started

author: danbonfil
title: Cardano DID Community SPO
description: SSI/DDI technologies will start to become more relevant in Cardano but there is no stake pool oriented to this segment

author: gpkumar24
title: Discounted Services for Delegation
description: People with business ideas / services may not have enough funding to get started

author: ampercy
title: SPO Training Lab in Uganda
description: Unreliable infrastructure and high cost of setting up a robust Cardano testnet in developing nations for aspiring SPO's and developers.

author: esgpool
title: Carbon Credit Methodology
description: Not all carbon credits are created equally and it can often be difficult to show provenance. Use SPs and the Cardano system to improve this

author: cardanopoolpeek1
title: Fair Stake Pool Selection
description: Many sites priorities ranking over many other metrics for pool selection. We provide the community the option of fairer selection.

author: gargiulo.gianni
title: Beyond ISOs: SPO-driven Funding
description: Current project funding models don't sufficiently support SPOs in their role as the financial and security backbone of Cardano.

author: al.kc
title: Small SPO Impact Business Programme
description: How can we enable SPOs to continue doing what they do best while creating effective businesses that achieve their purpose-led goals?

author: abehazbunjr
title: Tokenized Stake Tracking
description: Because staking offers no conversion tracking mechanism, SPOs have no visibility into the ROI of advertising or effective messaging.

author: rcmorano
title: Grow Dandelion, Grow SPO businesses
description: There are few-to-none solutions for SPOs to do professional Cardano API deployments that can help them to generate extra revenue streams.

author: adalywallet
title: Staking Pool as a Service
description: Setting up a staking pool is demanding. Even by doing everything by the book, you still need extensive knowledge and careful management.
